item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
item.description: 伦敦城。摄影师：Mike Kemp/Getty Images【原文：The City of London. Photographer: Mike Kemp/Getty Images】

item.title: 报告称，日本富人到 2030 年将增加投资 1.4 万亿美元
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的一项分析显示，随着现金流充裕的家庭在市场上进行更多的投资，到本十年末，日本巨富将促使他们投资的资产价值激增 30% 以上。【原文：Mega-wealthy Japanese will contribute to a more than 30% surge in the value of assets they invest by the end of the decade as cash-heavy households deploy more in markets, according to an analysis by Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: 谨慎的中国消费者面临新障碍：公用事业成本激增
item.description: 中国的消费者已经被房地产市场萧条和劳动力市场低迷拖累，现在又受到近期公用事业成本急剧上升的冲击。【原文：China’s consumers, already weighed down by a property-market bust and a lackluster labor market, are now getting hit by the steepest jump in utility costs in recent memory.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

 

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

 

】

item.title: 中国国家开发投资公司（SDIC）就泰国钾盐矿重大股权谈判进入后期阶段
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国国投矿业投资有限公司（SDIC Mining Investment Co.【原文：China’s SDIC Mining Investment Co. is in advanced talks for a significant minority stake in Asia Pacific Potash Corp., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 海鲜连锁店红龙虾申请破产保护
item.description: 海鲜连锁餐厅 Red Lobster 因繁重的租约和高昂的劳动力成本而申请破产。【原文：Seafood restaurant chain Red Lobster filed for bankruptcy, succumbing to onerous leases and high labor costs.】

item.title: 李氏汽车期权显示业绩公布前看涨押注增加
item.description: 在第一季度财报公布之前，期权交易商看好 Li Auto 公司的股票，因为该公司的毛利率可能会保持在 20% 以上。【原文：Options traders are bullish on shares of Li Auto Inc. ahead of first quarter earnings that will likely show gross margin staying above 20%.】

item.title: 与西方对抗的伊朗总统易卜拉欣-莱西逝世，享年 63 岁
item.description: 易卜拉欣-莱西（Ebrahim Raisi）是一位极端保守的神职人员，他在担任伊朗总统期间曾爆发大规模起义，并对西方采取日益鹰派的立场。享年 63 岁。【原文：Ebrahim Raisi, the ultraconservative cleric whose tenure as Iran’s president was marked by a mass uprising and an increasingly hawkish stance toward the West, has died after a helicopter crash. He was 63.】

item.title: 私募基金在英国大举举债引发危险警告
item.description:
在低价和廉价资金的诱惑下，收购公司对低利润率的英国消费品公司大肆挥霍。利率的提高正在颠覆这一赌注。【原文：

Buyout firms splurged on low-margin British consumer companies, seduced by bargain prices and cheap money. Higher interest rates are upending that wager.

】

item.title: 几乎所有被制裁的俄罗斯油轮在制裁数月后仍处于闲置和空载状态
item.description: 在被美国财政部制裁数月后，数十艘油轮依然无所作为；这表明美国只要愿意，就能破坏莫斯科的石油供应链。【原文：Dozens of tankers remain stuck doing nothing months after being sanctioned by the Treasury Department — a signal of the US’s scope to disrupt Moscow’s petroleum supply chain if it chooses to.】

item.title: 新西兰转向数据驱动的人口普查，为其他国家提供试验案例
item.description: 新西兰统计机构开始使用从其他地方收集的行政数据来生成五年一次的全国人口普查，随着人们越来越不愿意完成传统的调查，这一举措可能会受到其他国家的密切关注。【原文：New Zealand’s statistics agency is starting to use administrative data collected elsewhere to generate its five-yearly national census, a move that may be watched closely by other countries as people become more reluctant to complete traditional surveys.】

item.title: 越南将经济增长放在首位，挑战与日俱增
item.description: 越南副总理黎明凯（Le Minh Khai）表示，在全球需求疲软的挑战挥之不去的情况下，越南政府将优先支持经济增长。【原文：Vietnam’s government will prioritize supporting economic growth amid lingering challenges from weak global demand, Deputy Prime Minister Le Minh Khai said.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Ghisallo 在前瑞银银行家的帮助下开设香港办事处
item.description: Ghisallo 资本管理公司在前瑞银集团银行家 Carlo Agostinelli 的帮助下开设了香港办事处，这是对冲基金公司向香港扩张的一个越来越罕见的例子。【原文：Ghisallo Capital Management is opening a Hong Kong office with help from former UBS Group AG banker Carlo Agostinelli, an increasingly rare example of a hedge fund firm expanding to the city.】

item.title: 在日本央行政策押注下，日本 10 年期债券收益率创十年新高
item.description: 日本基准国债收益率攀升至 2013 年以来的最高点，原因是人们预期日本央行将致力于实现利率正常化，并为苦苦挣扎的日元提供支撑。【原文：Japan’s benchmark government bond yield climbed to highest since 2013 amid expectations that the Bank of Japan is committed to normalizing interest rates and supporting the struggling yen.】

item.title: 海外买家抢购中国股票与住房措施
item.description: 周五，随着习近平政府宣布一系列促进房地产市场发展的措施，外国买家纷纷抢购中国股票。【原文：Foreign buyers swooped in to purchase Chinese stocks on Friday as Xi Jinping’s government announced a slew of measures to bolster the housing market.】

item.title: 中国房地产股的飙升需要更进一步：图表
item.description: 中国房地产股需要出现可持续的好转，以增强投资者的信心，让他们相信今年股市的整体复苏势头能够保持甚至增强。【原文：China’s property stocks need a sustainable turnaround in order to foster investor confidence that this year’s broader equities recovery can maintain, or even increase its momentum.】

item.title: Norinchukin 考虑筹资 77 亿美元弥补债券损失
item.description: 一位熟知内情的人士透露，日本 Norinchukin 银行正在考虑融资 1.2 万亿日元（77 亿美元），以增加资本金并弥补因计划抛售低收益外国债券而造成的损失。【原文：Norinchukin Bank is considering raising 1.2 trillion yen ($7.7 billion) to boost capital and cover losses arising from a plan to get rid of low-yielding foreign bonds, a person familiar the matter said.】

item.title: 中国人民银行按兵不动，中国银行维持贷款利率不变
item.description: 在中国央行上周决定维持其向贷款人提供贷款的关键利率不变后，中国的银行维持基准贷款利率不变。【原文：Chinese banks left their benchmark lending rates unchanged following the central bank’s decision last week to hold a key rate on loans it offers to lenders.】

item.title: 贝恩资本加强日本房地产团队，前景看好
item.description: 贝恩资本（Bain Capital）计划加强其在日本的房地产团队，这是在日本房地产市场寻求机遇的最新一家全球投资公司。【原文：Bain Capital plans to bolster its real estate team in Japan, the latest global investment firm seeking to capitalize on opportunities in the nation’s property market.】

item.title: 美联储降息乐观情绪刺激黄金需求，黄金再创新高
item.description: 黄金创下历史新高，因为投资者对美国今年将降息的乐观情绪不断升温，整个大宗金属市场的需求也随之飙升。【原文：Gold notched a fresh all-time high, as investor demand soared across the broader metals complex amid increasing optimism the US will cut rates this year.】

item.title: 中国游客回流为 Trip.com 带来好消息
item.description: 随着越来越多的游客踏上旅途，中国旅游股也随之上扬，而在预订巨头 Trip.com Group Ltd. 周二发布财报后，中国旅游股可能会受到进一步提振。【原文：Chinese travel stocks have rallied as more tourists hit the road, and may get a further boost after bookings giant Trip.com Group Ltd. reports earnings on Tuesday.】

item.title: 西方资产押注日本央行政策转向将提振超长期债券
item.description: 西方资产管理公司（Western Asset Management Co.【原文：Western Asset Management Co. is betting that 30-year Japanese government bond yields won’t rise as much as shorter maturities as the Bank of Japan is less likely to cut holdings of ultra long-term debt.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 伊朗总统在直升机坠毁后失踪。马斯克在印度尼西亚发射 "星链"。亚洲股市有望攀升。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：Iran’s president missing after helicopter crash. Musk launches Starlink in Indonesia. Asia stocks looks set to climb. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 交易商关注地缘政治风险，石油维持周涨幅
item.description: 在上周末的袭击事件之后，俄罗斯和中东的地缘政治风险再次成为人们关注的焦点，石油保持了周线上涨。【原文：Oil held a weekly advance as geopolitical risks in Russia and the Middle East came back into focus after attacks over the weekend.】

item.title: 伦敦仍是欧洲金融投资者的首选；巴黎位居第二
item.description: 安永会计师事务所（Ernst & Young）的一项调查显示，在吸引金融服务领域的外国直接投资方面，伦敦仍是欧洲城市中的佼佼者，英国在新项目中所占的份额达到了十年来的最高水平。【原文：London still leads European cities in attracting foreign direct investment in financial services, with the UK’s share of new projects reaching the highest level in a decade, a survey by Ernst & Young showed.】

item.title: 外来票据适得其反，StanChart 韩国问题加深
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）在韩国竞争激烈的消费银行业务市场中坚持了下来，而其全球竞争对手却一个接一个地放弃了。现在，它正在付出代价。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc stuck it out in South Korea’s hotly contested consumer banking market while its global rivals threw in the towel one by one. It’s now paying the price.】

item.title: 亚洲股市在美国股市上涨和中国股市支撑后将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市因企业盈利强劲而创下新纪录，以及中国采取措施支撑房地产市场之后，亚洲股市早盘将攀升。【原文：Asian stocks are set to climb in early trading after US equities notched a fresh record amid resilient corporate earnings and China took steps to shore up its property market.】

item.title: 分析师称中国住房救助规模太小，不足以结束危机
item.description: 中国最新的住房措施针对的是空置房，这是这场持续了近三年的危机的一个主要痛点。但分析人士认为，这一揽子措施的力度仍然太小，不足以结束颓势。【原文：China’s latest housing initiative is aimed at vacant properties, a major pain point in a crisis that’s dragged on for almost three years. But the package of measures is still too small to end the rout, analysts say.】

item.title: 华尔街交易提速令全球金融岌岌可危
item.description:
各行各业的公司都在为即将到来的更快美股交割及其可能带来的问题做准备。【原文：

Firms of all stripes are preparing for the imminent shift to faster US stock settlement — and the issues it may bring.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 从白银和黄金到天然气和橙汁，大宗商品正一路高歌猛进。与此同时，铜市在纽约遭遇空头挤压后陷入动荡。中东冲突继续扰乱液化天然气的流通，同时推高了运输成本。【原文：From silver and gold to natural gas and orange juice, commodities are on a tear — with a gauge of major raw materials showing a steady march upwards. Meanwhile, copper markets are in upheaval following a short squeeze in New York. And Middle East conflicts continue to disrupt the flows of liquefied natural gas while driving up shipping costs.】
